backend/main.mo: Implements a signaling canister for WebRTC sessions, managing session creation, viewer joins, offers, candidates, and automatic session timeout cleanup.
backend/migration.mo: Defines a no-op migration module returning an empty state object.
feature_evidence.json: Lists feature evidence metadata linking product features to specific frontend files, components, and requirement IDs.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Provides prewritten summaries of numerous frontend files for reference or documentation purposes.
frontend/index.css: Global Tailwind-based style definitions including light/dark theme variables and base layout styling.
frontend/index.html: Minimal HTML entry point containing the root app container and script loader for the frontend.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Main React entry component handling screen navigation, viewer link parsing, and flow between camera, editor, gallery, live broadcast, and live viewer screens.
frontend/src/components/camera/MobileCam: A responsive camera control overlay for mobile and desktop with capture modes, camera switching, timers, grid, mirroring, zoom, and recording actions.
frontend/src/components/Footer.tsx: Simple footer displaying attribution text and a link to caffeine.ai.
frontend/src/components/Header.tsx: Responsive header with navigation buttons, app branding, and a theme toggle, adapting layout when on the camera screen.
frontend/src/components/HelpModal.tsx: A help dialog explaining camera permissions, video recording, and live streaming features using a modal with scrollable sections.
frontend/src/components/ThemeToggle.tsx: A button that toggles between light and dark themes using next-themes.
frontend/src/hooks/live/useLiveBroadcast: Hook managing live broadcast setup with WebRTC, signaling, session state, ICE handling, and cleanup.
frontend/src/hooks/live/useLiveViewer.ts: Hook for joining and viewing live streams via WebRTC, handling remote video, ICE candidates, and connection state.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Hook that creates and manages a backend actor based on Internet Identity, refreshing dependent queries on identity changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Internet Identity context and provider managing authentication, identity loading, login, logout, and status tracking.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: React Query hook placeholder for fetching backend metadata, currently returning empty data.
frontend/src/hooks/useVideoRecorder.ts: React hook that manages MediaRecorder-based video recording with state for errors, timing, and blob output.
frontend/src/index.css: Tailwind configuration and custom CSS variables for light/dark themes and camera-related utility classes.
frontend/src/lib/filters.ts: Canvas image filter utilities implementing effects like sepia, black-and-white, blur, and beauty smoothing.
frontend/src/lib/live/signaling.ts: Wrapper client for backend WebRTC signaling calls, handling offers, answers, and ICE candidate exchange.
frontend/src/lib/storage.ts: IndexedDB helpers for saving, retrieving, and deleting photos and videos in a local gallery.
frontend/src/main.tsx: App entry point that sets up React Query, identity provider, and renders the main App component.
frontend/src/pages/CameraScreen.tsx: Camera UI screen handling photo capture, video recording, timers, overlays, and storing captured media.
frontend/src/pages/EditorScreen.tsx: Provides a full photo editor with filters, beauty adjustments, stickers, masks, cropping, rotation, and export options rendered onto a canvas.
frontend/src/pages/GalleryScreen.tsx: Displays stored photos and videos, enabling preview, deletion, export, and storage management with a unified media list.
frontend/src/pages/LiveBroadcastScreen.t: Starts and manages a live broadcast from the device camera, showing stream status, shareable session info, and viewer count.
frontend/src/pages/LiveViewerScreen.tsx: Allows users to join and watch a live stream using a session code, managing connection state and remote video playback.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Configures TailwindCSS theme, colors, animations, and plugins including typography, container queries, and custom utilities.
project_state.json: Defines project version, highâ€‘level camera app goals, and a list of implemented feature records covering capture, filters, editing tools, gallery, persistence, and backend metadata integration.
